abstract.p: Dan Carsen letter fears powerful economic interests will succeed in their fight against plan to lessen automotive greenhouse emissions (Sept 23 article)

block.p: Re ''Automakers Attack Proposal to Address Global Warming'' (Business Day, Sept. 23):

Re ''Automakers Attack Proposal to Address Global Warming'' (Business Day, Sept. 23):

That powerful economic interests -- with their lawyers, lobbyists and eager politicians -- are lining up to fight an inadequate, baby-step plan to lessen automotive greenhouse emissions 30 percent by 2016 shows that our huge global warming experiment is likely to proceed unchecked.

We are all test subjects in the largest and most uncontrolled experimental trial in human history, and it's being conducted not by scientists but by uninformed consumers and profit-seeking organizations.

Increasingly chaotic weather is just one of many ugly realities we're going to have to accept, to say nothing of what our children and grandchildren will face. Any leader or would-be leader who dodges climate change is irresponsibly and immorally ignoring the real issue of the century.
